title: Change Your BRAIN By Using These Hacks to Increase Your DOPAMINE
author: Tom Bilyeu
description:
Dopamine is not a new topic.  People have been obsessing and hearing about dopamine and its role in human behavior for years. You may think of it as the feel-good happy hormone, or you may associate it with addiction, love, lust and sex.

As our lives convert over to a totally digital experience that is with us everywhere we are in the form of a cell phone, dopamine detox has even started gaining in popularity. 

Dr. Andrew Huberman from the Huberman Lab is back again to unpack some of the more surprising discoveries and uses of dopamine. 

He cleverly relates dopamine to being a biological currency that has a role to play in human desire for more. Dopamine is the catalyst pushing humanity forward exploring things like cryptocurrency and pushing our limitations and what is possible, but is all of that for the sake of pleasure and feeling good?

Dr. Huberman breaks down the eternal balance of pain and pleasure, arousal and relaxation and gives you the insight you need to start regulating your body’s dopamine release. If you thought dopamine was all about feeling good, Dr. Huberman is about to reveal why it’s more about what motivates you in the pursuit of something greater.
value_one: Explains the importance of managing dopamine to sustain goal seeking behaviour.
value_two: Explains the importance of pushing through to reach your goals even while experiencing pain in order to reap bigger rewards.

title: Kobe Bryant EXPLAINS The MINDSET Of A WINNER & How To SUCCEED
author: School of Greatness
description:
Kobe is widely regarded as one of the best basketball players of all time.

Kobe’s known for what he calls his Mamba Mentality, but it’s his big heart that is truly admirable. He is constantly reinventing himself and continuing to pursue new dreams.

There is so much power in his energy and presence. I know you’re really going to love this one.

So get ready to learn all about Mamba Mentality and how to embrace failure in Episode 691.

Some Questions I Ask:
Who was your greatest teacher?
What are some other things you do to raise the level of your teammates?
What’s been your greatest challenge since leaving the game?
What’s a constant theme in your life?
Why is storytelling important to you?
What’s your greatest weakness?

In This Episode, You Will Learn:
All about the “Mamba Mentality”
Why he has a passion for storytelling
Why you should be excited about failure
Kobe’s greatest moment in 20 seasons of basketball
Kobe’s daily routine
Plus much more…
value_one: Explains the importance of thinking long term when it comes to developing your skills and outworking your competition.
value_two: Explains the importance to raise the level of your teammates in any endeavor to reach greater highs.
value_three: Explains the importance of compassion and better understanding your teammates.

title: Les Brown on Impact Theory
author: Tom Bilyeu
description: Legendary motivational speaker Les Brown has overcome the most profound challenges. Over the course of his incredible career, he went from being labelled mentally retarded and working menial jobs to inspiring audiences of up to 80,000 people at a time. On this episode of Impact Theory with Tom Bilyeu, Les Brown shares the truth about how everyone has to fail their way to success. He also details his strategies for improving his mindset, explains exactly how he transformed the story he tells himself about himself, and talks about how to deal with negative thoughts and negative people.
value_one: Explains the importance of finding your uniqueness.
value_two: Explains the importance of not letting our circumstances shape us.
value_three: Explains the importance of making and sticking to ones commitments.
